featured.text: The residents worried about the county’s decision and action.
Some critics worry that online students will miss out on the social aspects of college.
With a large memory card to store pictures, you can shoot and shoot and never have to worry about changing a roll.

other.text: Conversely, worry can give a person an ulcer, high blood pressure, or even a heart attack.
To talk to the patient and ease his/her worries.
Researchers believe that a large part of the function of lullabies is to help a mother vocalize her worries and concerns.
Though the family knows she cannot be killed, they worry that their secret will be revealed when they try to kill her.
Whether simple or lavish, proms have always been more or less traumatic events for adolescents who worry about self-image and fitting in with their peers.
This information came from a very _____ source, so you don’t have to worry about being cheated.
You needn’t worry about the harm of a sedentary lifestyle because you exercise regularly, right?

definition.zh_def: 擔心或焦慮的情緒，通常對未來的事情感到不安。
definition.en_def: A feeling of concern or anxiety about something that may happen in the future.
definition.example: She couldn't help but worry about the upcoming exam.
